description:
QEMU loads -kernel and -inird arguments as binary blobs, without processing them through its block layer - that is only done for disk images (i.e., -drive file=...). I.e., from QEMU's perspective, all kernels and all initrds are raw format. QEMU's modular block drivers allow to add format support, e.g., for gzip'ed images.

When a different format is reported in place of "raw", Nova will unnecessarily try to convert the initramfs to raw format, which will still report the same format as before, leading to an exception being raised.

Therefore please do not run `qemu-img info` on files that are not disk images.

The source of the problem seems to be that the same libvirt_utils.fetch_image function is used for disk_images['kernel_id'] and disk_images['ramdisk_id'] as for disk_images['image_id']:

https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/virt/images.py?h=stable/kilo#n131

https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/virt/libvirt/utils.py?h=stable/kilo#n504

https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py?h=stable/kilo#n2741
title: Nova misuses qemu-img for kernel and initrd

comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~afaerber

comments.content:
s/-inird/-initrd/ obviously.

Another comment from the block maintainer, Kevin Wolf, was that raw images are expected to be block-aligned, which kernels and initrds are not necessarily. This may affect using `qemu-img convert` on such files.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~afaerber

comments.content:
The root cause comes from the nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py in the _create_image() method, where we make calls

            raw('kernel').cache(fetch_func=libvirt_utils.fetch_image,
            raw('ramdisk').cache(fetch_func=libvirt_utils.fetch_image,


These ultimately go down into the images.fetch_to_raw() method which runs qemu-img to probe & convert files.

Since we know the kernel+ramdisk files must *always* be provided in raw format, we should make sure we have a way to explicitly skip any use of qemu-img when fetching them from glance. We must use the data from glance as-is and unprocessed.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~berrange

comments.content:
Could you give more information on what you are trying to do here? Are there any steps to repeat the failure you are seeing?

A look over the code in https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/virt/images.py?h=stable/kilo#n131 seems to indicate that the kernel and initrd images will have qemu-img called on them before trying to covert them to raw. If the images are already in raw format then 'qemu-img info' should report this and no conversion should be applied.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mjdoffma

comments.content:
Please re-read: Nova is doing something incredibly stupid, probably just lazily because no one else ran into this corner case.

You can for instance replace qemu-img with a shell script calling the real one to assure that qemu-img is not getting called for the wrong files.

A more complicated reproducer is to patch qemu-img, e.g. github.com/openSUSE/qemu.git opensuse-2.3 branch with the following on top, and using a gzipped initrd.

diff --git a/block/Makefile.objs b/block/Makefile.objs
index c7e2178..4c4cd63 100644
--- a/block/Makefile.objs
+++ b/block/Makefile.objs
@@ -25,8 +25,8 @@ block-obj-y += write-threshold.o
 common-obj-y += stream.o
 common-obj-y += commit.o
 common-obj-y += backup.o
-common-obj-y += dictzip.o
-common-obj-y += tar.o
+block-obj-y += dictzip.o
+block-obj-y += tar.o
 
 iscsi.o-cflags     := $(LIBISCSI_CFLAGS)
 iscsi.o-libs       := $(LIBISCSI_LIBS)

commit 15f3e2661e53c7eef034347c9fd15c4d621c36a7
Author: Mark Doffman <email address hidden>
Date:   Fri Sep 18 14:03:15 2015 -0500

    libvirt: Don't attempt to convert initrd images.
    
    Fetching kernel or initrd images used the same code
    path as main images. This should not be the case as
    these should never be resized, and should always be
    in 'raw' format.
    
    Kernel and inird images are now fetched directly
    without any checks for types and bypassing any
    attempted resizes or conversions.
    
    Closes-Bug: #1497293
    Change-Id: I9ab0391bb681185e8fe236698f5721d6cf25689b
